---
title: Next Steps
---

Congratulations on completing the practical! Here's how to continue your data science journey.

## Continue Learning

### Free Online Courses

**For R:**

- [R for Data Science (2e)](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/) - Comprehensive free book by Hadley Wickham
- [RStudio Primers](https://posit.cloud/learn/primers) - Interactive tutorials
- [Swirl](https://swirlstats.com/) - Learn R programming interactively

**For Python:**

- [Python for Everybody](https://www.py4e.com/) - Free course by University of Michigan
- [Kaggle Learn](https://www.kaggle.com/learn) - Practical micro-courses
- [DataCamp](https://www.datacamp.com/) - First course free, student discounts available

**Statistics & Machine Learning:**

- [StatQuest](https://www.youtube.com/c/joshstarmer) - Excellent YouTube channel for statistics
- [Introduction to Statistical Learning](https://www.statlearning.com/) - Free book with R and Python code
- [fast.ai](https://www.fast.ai/) - Practical deep learning for coders

### University Resources

**At Leeds:**

- Check for data science modules in your program
- Attend research seminars and workshops
- Join data science student groups
- Explore [Leeds Institute for Data Analytics (LIDA)](https://lida.leeds.ac.uk/)

## Practice with Real Data

### Transport-Specific Datasets

- [UK Department for Transport Statistics](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-transport/about/statistics)
- [Transport for London Open Data](https://tfl.gov.uk/info-for/open-data-users/)
- [Propensity to Cycle Tool](https://www.pct.bike/) - Cycling transport data

### General Data Sources

- [data.gov.uk](https://www.data.gov.uk/) - UK government data
- [Our World in Data](https://ourworldindata.org/) - Global development data
- [Kaggle Datasets](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets) - Thousands of datasets for practice
- [TidyTuesday](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday) - Weekly data challenges

## Join Communities

### Online Communities

- [RStudio Community](https://community.rstudio.com/) - Friendly R forum
- [r/datascience](https://www.reddit.com/r/datascience/) - Reddit data science community
- [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/) - Programming Q&A
- [Cross Validated](https://stats.stackexchange.com/) - Statistics Q&A

### Local Meetups

- [R User Groups](https://jumpingrivers.github.io/meetingsR/) - Find local R meetups
- [PyData](https://pydata.org/) - Python data science meetups
- Check [Meetup.com](https://www.meetup.com/) for data science events in Leeds

## Build Your Portfolio

### Project Ideas

1. **Analyze local transport patterns** using TfL or Leeds data
2. **Recreate published analyses** to learn techniques
3. **Participate in Kaggle competitions** (start with "Getting Started" competitions)
4. **Contribute to open source** R or Python packages
5. **Create a blog** documenting your learning journey

### Share Your Work

- Create a [GitHub](https://github.com/) profile for your code
- Build a portfolio website with [Quarto](https://quarto.org/)
- Write blog posts about what you learn
- Share projects on social media (#RStats, #DataScience)

## Advanced Topics to Explore

Once you're comfortable with basics:

### Data Science Skills

- **Version Control**: Git and GitHub for collaboration
- **Reproducible Research**: R Markdown, Quarto, Jupyter notebooks
- **Databases**: SQL for working with large datasets
- **Big Data**: Spark, cloud computing (AWS, Google Cloud)

### Specialized Topics

- **Spatial Data Science**: Working with geographic data (check out [geocompx.org](https://geocompx.org/))
- **Machine Learning**: Supervised and unsupervised learning
- **Deep Learning**: Neural networks for complex patterns
- **Time Series Analysis**: For temporal data
- **Network Analysis**: For transport networks and relationships

### Transport-Specific Skills

- **Transport Modeling**: Learn about the [A/B Street](https://github.com/a-b-street/abstreet) project
- **Route Planning**: OpenTripPlanner, OSRM
- **GIS**: QGIS, ArcGIS for spatial analysis
- **Transport Data**: Working with GTFS, OpenStreetMap

## Certification & Professional Development

### Certifications (Optional)

- [RStudio Certification](https://www.rstudio.com/certification/)
- [Google Data Analytics Certificate](https://www.coursera.org/professional-certificates/google-data-analytics)
- [Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/azure-data-scientist/)

### Books Worth Reading

- **R for Data Science** - Wickham & Grolemund
- **The Art of Statistics** - David Spiegelhalter
- **Storytelling with Data** - Cole Nussbaumer Knaflic
- **Python for Data Analysis** - Wes McKinney

## Setting Goals

### Short-term (Next Month)

- [ ] Complete one online course/tutorial
- [ ] Analyze one dataset of personal interest
- [ ] Join one online community
- [ ] Learn one new visualization technique

### Medium-term (3-6 Months)

- [ ] Complete a personal data project
- [ ] Contribute to an open source project
- [ ] Attend a meetup or conference
- [ ] Build a portfolio website

### Long-term (1 Year)

- [ ] Master one data science specialization
- [ ] Publish a blog post or tutorial
- [ ] Complete a Kaggle competition
- [ ] Apply data science in your research/work
